channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023061727
item.description:
Report X-2023061727

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the 1-3-5 Unload and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: One of the four bottles of chlorinating liquid developed a crack in its body allowing for a leak to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the All-Other Material pallet.

item.title: Report X-2023061698
item.description:
Report X-2023061698

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE LOADING DOCKS IC BELT LEAKING. THE ADMIN PLACED THE LEAKING HAZMAT INSIDE A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE CONTAINS 4 4L GLASS JARS OF ACETONE. ONE OF THE GLASS JARS HAD BROKEN INSIDE THE PACKAGE. CAUSING FOR THE ACETONE TO LEAK OUT AND SOAK THROUGH THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED GLASS JAR WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM WITH THE DAMAGED PACKAGE. THE UNDAMAGED ITEMS WERE ALSO REPACKED TO BE RTS.

item.title: Report X-2023061690
item.description:
Report X-2023061690

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE UNLOADING DOCK LEAKING. THE ADMIN PLACED THE HAZMAT INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: ONE OUT OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD THE LID COME LOOSE CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT INTO THE PACKAGE. AFTER CHECKING FTRACK FOUND THAT THE HAZMAT WAS NEVER PROCESSED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023061560
item.description:
Report X-2023061560

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS LOADED TO THE VAN AND TAKEN OUT BY THE DRIVER. DRIVER BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO THE DUE TO TOP OF THE BOX BEING WET. DescribePack: CAP LOOSE ON 1 BOTTLE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CAPS TIGHTENED AND FOLD ABSORD APPLIED TO THE BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023061516
item.description:
Report X-2023061516

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking by the unload when it arrived at the station. Package placed into a lined tote and removed to the hazmat cage for processing DescribePack: It appears that the product leaked via the vented caps due to improper loading and DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fans in the area, placed in a lined sealed tote.
